{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about the motor supply of infrahyoid muscles. Infrahyoid muscles are located in the neck and are responsible for movements such as tilting and rotating the hyoid bone. The ventral ramus of C1-C4 nerves, which form the cervical plexus, innervate these muscles. Therefore, the motor supply of infrahyoid muscle is from branches of the cervical plexus.", "answer_choice": "A"}
